analyzed: 與大眾俱及於護世四大天王多聞天王最為上首。
translated: Together with the great assembly, as well as the Four Heavenly Kings who protect the world, with the Heavenly King of the Tushita Heaven as the foremost.
At that time, the World-Honored One told the Four Heavenly Kings:
There is great fear and deep loathing.

original: 汝等應知若男若女童男童女若人若天。
analyzed: 汝等應知若男若女童男童女若人若天。
translated: You should know that whether male or female, young men or young women, humans or gods,
I see that premature death brings great fear.
It constantly disturbs and torments, and each cannot save the other.
Up to old age and death, it is very frightening.
Yet it is endless.
I will now tell you the Dharma of saving and protecting.
At that time, the Four Heavenly Kings in the assembly
said to the Buddha, World-Honored One,
today we, in the presence of the World-Honored One,
Having heard this teaching, they will be overjoyed.
With their bodies, lives, and wealth, they will offer to the Tathāgata.
They wish for the Buddha to have compassion and explain it for them.
At that time, the World-Honored One, in the time it takes a snap of the fingers,

translated: facing east, abides and speaks these words: Homage to the Buddhas of the ten directions.

original: 一切如來無上正等正覺。
analyzed: 一切如來無上正等正覺。
translated: All unsurpassed, perfectly enlightened ones,
with vast compassion, take pity on sentient beings.

original: 彼皆證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
analyzed: 彼皆證得阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translated: They have all realized supreme, perfect enlightenment.
I only wish that with compassionate observation,
they will bestow their spiritual power and protection on those who cling to self.
Eliminate untimely death and expound and explain this.

translated: I only wish that with compassionate observation, they will expound and explain this for those who cling to self.
At that time, the Buddhas of the ten directions all jointly bore witness.

analyzed: 今此神呪是一切佛證明觀察。

If there are sons and daughters of good family,

original: 晝夜受持志誠憶念。🔽必獲長命而無中夭。
analyzed: 晝夜受持志誠憶念。 必獲長命而無中夭。
translated: who day and night uphold it with sincere intention and recollection,🔽they will surely attain longevity without dying prematurely.
After death, they will not fall into evil destinies.
If there are people who benefit sentient beings,
They should sincerely uphold and recite this sutra.
At the time of death, they will have no fear,
No strange occurrences or evil signs.

original: 於現在世又無白癩顛狂諸病。
analyzed: 於現在世又無白癩顛狂諸病。
translated: In this present life, they will be free from white leprosy, insanity, and other illnesses,

analyzed: 及離水火刀兵疾疫蟲藥等毒。
translated: As well as from the dangers of water, fire, weapons, epidemics, and poisonous insects and medicines.

original: 乃至雷雹一切諸難皆悉遠離。
analyzed: 乃至雷雹一切諸難皆悉遠離。
translated: They will be far away from all difficulties, such as thunder, hail, and so forth.
Wherever this sutra is,

analyzed: 十方諸佛及眾菩薩悉皆來集。
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas of the ten directions will all gather there.
They will protect this sutra and prevent any obstacles or difficulties.
If there are people who, with regard to this sutra,
Copy it, adorn it, uphold it, and recite it,
It will be like creating a Buddha image and adorning it in various ways.
The merit they will obtain will be no different.

original: 若復有人供養諸佛精心離慢。
analyzed: 若復有人供養諸佛精心離慢。
translated: If there are people who make offerings to the Buddhas with a sincere mind free from arrogance,
They will obtain auspicious blessings and eliminate calamities and difficulties.

original: 若有受持書寫此經恒離懈怠。
analyzed: 若有受持書寫此經恒離懈怠。
translated: If there are people who uphold and copy this sutra, always free from laziness,
The merit obtained is also like this.

original: 一切聖賢常恒擁護離諸災患。
analyzed: 一切聖賢常恒擁護離諸災患。
translated: All sages and saints will always protect and guard, and one will be free from all calamities and misfortunes.
At that time, after the World-Honored One had spoken this sutra,

analyzed: 四大天王龍神八部阿蘇囉等。
translated: the Four Heavenly Kings, dragons, the eight groups of spiritual beings, asuras, and so forth,
as well as all the great assemblies of humans and gods,
heard the Dharma with joy, and faithfully accepted and practiced it.
